intro: Pterophylla commersonii, commonly known as the Commerson's pterophylla, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its unique, pinnately divided leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
